name: Brain Hood
description: A tiny aberration with a head resembling a brain, capable of merging with beasts to control them while wielding innate spellcasting and physical attacks.
memorable: The ability to control beasts in combat and its combination of psychic and physical capabilities make it a unique and tricky adversary.
goals: To control beasts and manipulate the battlefield using its spells.
relations: Potential allies or foes include beasts with low intelligence, as well as other aberrations.
environment: Typically found in areas where it can encounter beasts, such as forests or wilderness.
strengths: Good dexterity and intelligence for offensive and defensive actions, including spellcasting and controlling beasts.
weaknesses: Low strength and vulnerability due to its low hit points; relies on others for protection.
attacks: Slam attack that delivers modest bludgeoning damage and can initiate its merging ability with beasts.
most_powerful_ability: Merge with Beast, allowing it to control beasts while retaining its own personality and spellcasting ability.
senses: Possesses blindsight up to 60 feet, granting it detection of creatures within that range while being blind beyond.
skills: Has exceptional dexterity saving throws, reflecting its agile nature.
additional_information: Can communicate telepathically with a range of 60 feet
Utilizes innate spellcasting without needing components
Retains its personality while merged with another creature
spellcasting: Can cast spells like acid splash, chilling touch, and burning hands, utilizing its intelligence.
test_queries: psychic creature that merges with animals
monster with blindsight and innate spells
